donor_name: UNITED STATES AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT (USAID)
US Department of State, Office to monitor & combat Tracking in persons.
outputs.output_descr:
The project intends to achieve three high-level results throughout Abkhazia by the end of the program:
1/ Improved healthcare system and increased population awareness of HIV/AIDS prevention methods;
2/ Expanded learning opportunities for young population and increased access to different forms of modern communication technologies; and
3/ Enhanced community participation leading to confidence in the Abkhazia population as well as community development and improved infrastructure at the community level.
Groundwork for reconciliation with Abkhazia laid through cross-boundary linkages and improved healthcare services.

UNDP has embraced a comprehensive, long-term approach to CPR, encompassing not only direct engagement in conflict zones, but also a systematic attention to potential drivers of conflict and instability country-wide. UNDP is in a position to strengthen its Conflict Prevention and recovery (CPR) portfolio as a competent, trusted partner of the Government and, hence, will undertake the following:
1. Promote livelihoods and confidence-building in Abkhazia by focusing on areas that have demonstrated the highest potential for confidence-building: 
• Water supply systems rehabilitated in three villages.
• Capacities and productivity of farmers groups strengthened.
• Functioning of extension services strengthened.
• Integrated pest management.
2. Strengthen office capacity with a CPR manager to supervise the Abkhazia livelihoods and confidence-building activities and initiate projects on the national level, such as: 
• Address capacity needs of the Ministry of Conflict Resolution.
• Youth participation and opportunities promoted around values of peaceful co-existence, respect for diversity and inclusive citizenship.
• Mainstreaming of conflict sensitivity within UNDP programming.

project_descr: Supporting Livelihoods and Promoting Peace Building in Georgia
